result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Jowett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Jackson County Case No. 15CF117 and 16CF165.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant  shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the victim, unless the victims requests through the agent, and the agent approves.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Comply with any recommended mental health evaluations.

Comply with recommended placement upon release from custody.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Jowett

defendant.name: Jowett, Daniel J
defendant.address: 5 S Roosevelt, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing hearing held on 2-1-2018

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Prior.  Court ensures the parties have the correct PSI.  Victim notification has been complied with.  State recommended:  2 years.  Bifurcated as 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision on count 2 of 16CF165.  Count 3 in 16CF165:  9 months jail.  Concurrent.  16CM141.  2 years probation.  Consecutive to other files, but concurrent to each other.  Conditions:   No contact with the victims or females under the age of 18.  Comply with sex offender program and recommended treatment.  Comply with a mental health evaluation and recommended treatment.  Comply with any placement recommendations of his agent.  Comply with the Sex Offender Registry Program.  Complete a Sex Offender Assessment and comply with recommended treatment.  Adopt conditions recommended by the agent.

Attorney Prior noted some corrections in the PSI.  Defense recommended:  16CF165.  Count 2,  2 years.  Bifurcated as 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision.  Count 3:  9 months jail. 2 years probation on 16CM141, concurrent.  Not have to register as a sex offender.  Other conditions as outlined by the agent appropriate.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.

Court ordered:  16CF165.  Count 2: 2 years total.  Bifurcated as 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision.  Concurrent to 15CF117.  9 months jail on count 3. Concurrent to Count 2.  16CM141.  sentence withheld:  2 years probation, concurrent to each other.  Consecutive to 15CF117 and 16CF165.

ES/probation conditions:  No contact with the victims, unless victims request from the agent and agent approves.  No unsupervised contact with female minors under the age of 18.  Not to be where minors are expected to frequent.  Complete a Sex Offender Assessment and comply with recommended treatment.  Not to use or possess any alcohol, drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Comply with all assessments and evaluations ordered by the agent.  Comply with any recommended mental health evaluations. Comply with recommended placement upon release from custody. Maintain absolute sobriety.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.  CC.  Credit for 22 days in 16CF165.
Sentencing hearing on February 1, 2018 at 11:30 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Prior.  Victim notification complied with.  Parties have the PSI.   State noted corrections.  No one contacted the PSI writer regarding the incorrect information in the PSI.  Court concerned.  Parties do have a joint recommendation.  Counsel to contact the PSI writer in writing expressing concerns of errors, and conflict of interest.  SEH to be rescheduled.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  Defendant plead no contest to counts 1-5 in 16CM141.  Remaining counts in that case dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes.   Defendant plead no contest to Counts 2 and 3 and Count 1 dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes in 16CF165.  Victim notifications complied with.  Court reviewed charges and possible penalties of the counts the defendant plead to.   Defendant understood.  Priors confirmed by the court with the defendant and Attorney Prior.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  He understood.  Defendant's mental status discussed.  He is competent to proceed per his attorney.   Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas for the counts he plead to.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child contrary to 948.10(1)(a), Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor contrary to 946.49(1)(a) and 5 counts of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 contrary to 943.20(1)(a) all as a repeater contrary to 939.62(1)(a).  Parties requesting a PSI.  Due 11/30.  Defense requesting that the Jackson County probation office not prepare the PSI, as one of the agents in that office is a victim.  SEH 12/12/17 at 3 pm.  Defendant given DNA order.
Sentencing hearing on December 12, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on October 16, 2017 at 10:00 am.
PLEAH canceled at request of Atty Prior and confirmed with DA's office due to defendant's scheduled revocation hearing on another case.
Status conference on October 9, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on July 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.   Set for a plea.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel J Jowett
Current: 5 S Roosevelt, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 05-15-2017)
Prior: 419 S 1st St #101, Black River Falls, WI 54615
Status conference on May 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Prior.  ATR has been completed.  State will now make an offer.  STC set for 5/15 at 3 pm.
Status conference on April 24, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Pior.  Defendant is in Wisconsin Resource Center.  Not sure how long it will take.  Doing the programs.  STC 4/24 at 3 pm
Status conference on February 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Prior.  Attorney Prior waiting for some information from WRC.  STC set 2/20 at 3 pm.
Status conference on January 30, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Prior.  Defendant at ATR at the Wisconsin Resource Center.  Could be 9 months long.  STC set for 1/30 at 3 pm.
Eric from WI Resource Ctr called ref to today's hearing; trf call to Judge Becker's office

Covers 16CM141 and 16CF165.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: any female under the age of 18 years old.  Comply with all rules of the Wisconsin Resource Center, and not to leave the Center unless formaly discharged, or has his agent's approval.  Release only to the Wisconsin Resource Center through DOC.  Signature bond takes effect when transported to the Wisconsin Resource Center.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Prior appeared in court.  Stipulated modification of bond.

Pre-trial conference on October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Prior appeared in court.  Waive reading of the amended complaint.  NGP entered.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 10/5 and STC set for 10/24 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: with any of the victims contained in the complaint, or their residences.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  Defendant has a copy of the complaint.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Attorney options explained to the defendant.  Defendant will contact SPD.  AIA set for 9/12 at 9 am.
destroyed
